MASSIGLFS VISIT.Memorandum by the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.I circulate to my colleagues herewith a translation of the letter which Ihave received from M. Massigli, the French Commissioner for Foreign Affairs,expressing his appreciation of the welcome which he received from His Majesty'sGovernment during his recent visit.A. E.Foreign Office, 3rd September, 1944.Letter from M. Massigli to Mr. Eden.(Translation.)M. le Secretaire d'Etat, London, 28th August, 1944.I would not like to leave London without telling you how touched I havebeen by the welcome which has been given to me by His Majesty's Governmentand by yourself in particular. It would not have been possible to give me moremoving testimony of the sympathy of your country for mine.It is for me an inestimable privilege to have experienced in London theemotions of these historic days, and both I and my fellow-countrymen who were able to be present were profoundly moved by this morning's ceremony.I will render a faithful account of these days to General de Gaulle and the.iubcrs of the VTOvernnieriL. jl Know now much they will appreciate the marksof friendship which have been shown to my country. I will at the same timegive an account of our conversations; I have every confidence that they will havenappy results in drawing closer the bonds between our two countries.May I ask you to express my gratitude to His Majesty's Government? may i also thank you personally for the large share which you took in the marks of friendship which were shown to me in abundance?MASSIGLI.[28138]
